text.paragraph:
JHL FIN V295-6015-4181 Date(s): 2021-08-18 - 2021-08-21
Garcia, Morgan and Salazar 48491 Spence Terrace Apt. 258 North Debra, KY 40202- (+1-5524541545
Discharge Disposition: OP Self Care or Home
Attending Physician: Bailey, NP-FAM
Admitting Physician: Bailey, NP-FAM
Referring Physician: May, MD-INT

tr.td: Title: Advanced Heart Failure Clinic Consult Note

Patient: PARKER, Michael Daniel mrn:a440517097 fin:K2462813461
Age: 50 Years Sex: Male DOB: 1970-12-03
Seen in Advanced Heart Failure Clinic for follow up

50 year old male with phx:
ICM
--Echo 11-2020: LVEF 29%, LVDD 6.4, mild RVE with mild RV hypokinesis, mild MR/TR
--Echo 10-2019: LVEF 26%, LVDD 5.96, G3DD, mild MR
--Echo 4-2019: LVEF 10%, LVDD 6.18, no thrombus, mild MR/TR
--Echo 11-2018 @ UofL: LVEF 13%
--Echo 10-2018: LVEF 25%, LVDD 6.6, mild MR/PR
--Echo 3-2017: LVEF 39%, LVDD 5.8, mild MR
--Echo 8-2015: LVEF 30-35%, LVDD 6.00, mild MR
ICD (St. Jude)
--Prior VF arrest
CAD
--LHC 3-2019: LM/LAD/LCX patent arteries and patent prox RCA stent
--s/p MI and PCI to RCA around 2014
HTN
T2DM
COPD
OSA
CKD, stage III
Persistent Afib
Obesity, class II
Pulm HTN
Depression
Mr. Parker was located at home and I was located at Advanced HF clinic for this telehealth encounter. I introduced myself and verified his identity. I explained how the telemedicine visit will occur. I advised that technology-related delays and breaches of privacy are potential risks associated with conducting the encounter via telemedicine. I also advised that at any point he may terminate the telemedicine encounter and withdraw his consent for receiving care via telemedicine without affecting his ability to receive future care from us, and that I may also terminate the telemedicine encounter if I determine that an in-person visit is more appropriate for the condition[s] for which treatment is sought. Having covered these considerations, the patient verbally acknowledged them and gave consent for the use of telemedicine in his care.
He was last seen while admitted 2013-08-08-15-2020 with ADHF. He was diuresed with IV diuretics with a documented 20 lb weight loss. He was discharged home with plans to follow up outpatient. At discharged he was started on Farxiga but he states he has not yet received that from his pharmacy and was told he needs more paperwork before it can be approved.
States he is feeling much "better". He is less SOA than prior to his admission. He can perform his ADL's and carry out his normal activities with no SOA or fatigue. He denies any recent swelling or weight gain. States he is working harder on adhering to his fluid and sodium restriction. He denies PND/Orthopnea/CP/Palpitations/N/V/syncope/bleeding/falls. No fevers/rigors/chills/sick contacts/diarrhea/constipation/urinary symptoms/tremors/visual or auditory disturbances/balance issues/aches or pain in the joints or muscle. He has some dizziness with quick position changes.
Ten systems were reviewed and were negative unless otherwise noted in the HPI.

Wt: 232 lbs (240 at discharge per home scale)
HR: 82
BP: 96/59

50 year old male with phx:
ICM
--Echo 11-2020: LVEF 29%, LVDD 6.4, mild RVE with mild RV hypokinesis, mild MR/TR
--Echo 10-2019: LVEF 26%, LVDD 5.96, G3DD, mild MR
--Echo 4-2019: LVEF 10%, LVDD 6.18, no thrombus, mild MR/TR
--Echo 11-2018 @ UofL: LVEF 13%
--Echo 10-2018: LVEF 25%, LVDD 6.6, mild MR/PR
--Echo 3-2017: LVEF 39%, LVDD 5.8, mild MR
--Echo 8-2015: LVEF 30-35%, LVDD 6.00, mild MR
ICD (St. Jude)
--Prior VF arrest
CAD
--LHC 3-2019: LM/LAD/LCX patent arteries and patent prox RCA stent
--s/p MI and PCI to RCA around 2014
HTN
T2DM
COPD
OSA
CKD, stage III
Persistent Afib
Obesity, class II
Pulm HTN
Depression
1. Chronic HFrEF with low cardiac output on home Inotrope therapy
ICM
--Echo 11-2020: LVEF 29%, LVDD 6.4, mild RVE with mild RV hypokinesis, mild MR/TR
--Echo 10-2019: LVEF 26%, LVDD 5.96, G3DD, mild MR
--Echo 4-2019: LVEF 10%, LVDD 6.18, no thrombus, mild MR/TR
--Echo 8-2015: LVEF 30-35%, LVDD 6.00, mild MR
ICD (St. Jude): no shocks
Stage D
Currently NYHA Class II symptoms on home inotrope
compensated
--RHC 2021-07-05 (Without any home afterload medications): RA 8/11, 7; RV 54/0, 5; PA 45/23, 30; PCW 24; TPG 6; CO/CI 4.7/2.1
RHC 2020-07-15: RA 8, 59/2 (8), PA 55/26 (38), PCW 28, TPG 10, PVR 2.2; Fick CO/CI 4.5/2.1, Thermal CO/CI 2.9/1.4
CPET 2020-07-15: MVO2 13, RER 1.14
Inotrope: milrinone @ 0.375 mcg/kg/min
Diuretic: Bumex 3mg po tid & metolazone 2.5mg Monday, wed, friday Labs weekly per home health.
BB: Toprol XL 25 mg po qd with meals.
ACE/ARB: none due to CKD
Ald Antag: spironolactone 50mg po qd
H/N: Hydralazine 100 mg po tid. Imdur 30 mg po qd.
SGLT2 inhibitor: Farxiga 10 mg po qd to help prevent HF hospitalizations (started at discharge but has not received yet). Watch GFR closely.
Advanced HF Therapies:
He is not a candidate for OHTx due to uncontrolled diabetes and BMI >35. He was evaluated for LVAD. Dr. Dunbar, LVAD coordinator, and Social Worker met with him and his brother and plan for LVAD after brother has foot surgery (January) so he can be available as social support.
2. CAD
--s/p PCI to RCA 2014
--LHC 3-2019: LM/LAD/LCX patent arteries and patent prox RCA stent
no angina
continue statin, ASA, and BB
3. Persistent Afib
continue BB and Xarelto
4. CKD, stage III
labs weekly per home health to be tomorrow
5. Obesity, class II with comorbidities
BMI 41.5
encouraged to work on weight loss through healthy eating and calorie reduction
encouraged to increase activity
educated on the importance of maintaining BMI <35 in order to qualify for OHTx in future
7. OSA
untreated
states he sleeps well without cpap machine
reeducated on OSA and treatments
8. HTN
low today
continue meds as above
10. Depression
follows with psyche
11. Chronic pain
--c/o muscle spasms especially in legs
recently started on duloxetine 40 mg po qd per PCP
recommend pain management referral if no improvement
Recommendations:
1. Farxiga 10 mg po qd
2. labs weekly per home health
3. call for > 2 lb weight gain
4. Follow up in Advanced HF clinic in 1 months/sooner PRN

Ongoing
CHF (congestive heart failure)
COPD (chronic obstructive pulmonary disease)
Diabetes
HTN (hypertension)
MI (myocardial infarction)
MEASURE OF CARDIAC SAMPL & PRESSURE, R HEART, PERC APPROACH (2021-07-05), Defibrillator, device, Stented coronary artery.

Home Medications (19) Active
AdmeLOG 15 Units, SubCutaneous, TIDAC
aspirin 81 mg oral delayed release tablet 81 mg, Oral, Daily
atorvastatin 20 mg oral tablet 20 mg = 1 Tab, Oral, At Bedtime
Basaglar KwikPen 100 units/mL subcutaneous solution 48 Units, SubCutaneous, Daily
bumetanide 2 mg oral tablet 3 mg = 1.5 Tab, Oral, TID
colchicine 0.6 mg oral capsule 0.6 mg = 1 Cap, PRN, Oral, Daily
dapagliflozin 5 mg oral tablet 5 mg = 1 Tab, Oral, Daily
DULoxetine 60 mg, Oral, Daily
gabapentin 100 mg oral capsule 200 mg = 2 Cap, Oral, BID
hydrALAZINE 100 mg oral tablet 100 mg = 1 Tab, Oral, TID
isosorbide mononitrate 30 mg oral tablet, extended release 30 mg = 1 Tab, Oral, QAM
magnesium oxide 400 mg (241.3 mg elemental magnesium) oral tablet 800 mg = 2 Tab, Oral, Daily
metOLazone 2.5 mg oral tablet 2.5 mg = 1 Tab, Oral, TuThSa
Metoprolol Succinate ER 25 mg oral tablet, extended release 25 mg = 1 Tab, Oral, Daily
milrinone 1 mg/mL intravenous solution 0.375 mcg/kg/Min, IntraVENous
Nitrostat 0.4 mg, PRN, SubLINgual, Q5Min
potassium chloride 20 mEq oral tablet, extended release 60 mEq, Oral, TID
spironolactone 50 mg, Oral, Daily
Xarelto 15 mg oral tablet 15 mg = 1 Tab, Oral, Daily
correction to above meds:
Farxiga 10 mg po qd
Hydralazine 100 mg po tid
KCL 80 meq po tid

Alcohol
Alcohol Use History No.
Alcohol Use History No.
Substance Abuse
Drug Use Hx: No.
Tobacco
Smoking Status Never smoker.
labs every Tuesday per home health
